summary: This video captures the unique love story and life journey of Simone Biles Owens, a world-renowned gymnast, and Jonathan Owens, a professional football player. It traces their meeting on a dating app, the challenges they faced, and their ultimate commitment to marriage, all while emphasizing Simone's advocacy for mental health.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a vibrant scene of a football game, where a player in a green and yellow jersey embraces a woman in a black jacket, set against a stadium backdrop. The text "2023 BACK THAT YEAR UP" appears, suggesting a motivational theme. The scene transitions to a woman with long braids, wearing a teal shirt and a necklace with the name "OWENS," speaking indoors with a window in the background. The video then shifts to a gymnastics competition, showcasing a gymnast in a red leotard performing on the uneven bars, with the text "WHICH IS HARDER, ACTUALLY?" displayed, prompting viewers to consider the difficulty of the sport. The focus then moves to a close-up of a woman with a ponytail and gold earrings, followed by a gymnast in a red leotard executing a flip on a blue mat. The narrative continues with a split-screen view of two men at a desk with a "peacock" logo, and the woman in the teal shirt speaking again. The video then highlights a gymnast in a red and white leotard preparing for a routine, followed by a scene of the same gymnast in a training room, wearing a white arm sleeve and holding a bar. The video concludes with a close-up of the gymnast's focused expression, emphasizing her determination and skill.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a brief conversation between a male and a female, debating which one is the better athlete. This discussion appears related to NFL and gymnastics, as the female speaker mentions the debate involves Simone Biles and her husband. She recounts how her husband struggled with her gym workout, while she excelled at an NFL workout, seemingly implying her athletic superiority. The conversation then transitions to upbeat, energetic music with a pop or electronic style, maintaining a consistent and driving rhythm. The instruments seem to include synthesizers and percussion, creating a high-spirited mood. No specific background sounds are present beyond the music.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a shirtless man wearing a black cap and a woman in a black hat standing close together, both smiling and looking at each other. The scene transitions to a formal event where a man in a white suit and a woman in a white dress are seated at a table adorned with white flowers, surrounded by other guests. The next scene shows a group of football players in white and red uniforms celebrating on the field, with a stadium full of spectators in the background. Following this, a man in a brown shirt and a woman in a black blazer are seen sitting together at an event, with the man holding a microphone. The video then shifts to a woman with long braided hair wearing a white sweater, speaking in an indoor setting with a cityscape visible through the windows. The next scene features a man in a colorful shirt and a woman in a black top standing together in a stadium with red seats. The video concludes with a woman in a striped shirt holding a white mug and a smartphone, standing by a window with a view of a brick building outside. Throughout the video, the scenes transition smoothly, showcasing various moments of joy, celebration, and casual interaction among the individuals featured.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker enthusiastically describing how "Simone Biles and Jonathan Owens get along famously." He elaborates on their unique love story, mentioning their initial encounter at a Texans game in 2019 and their subsequent meeting on the dating app Raya in March 2020, emphasizing that "it was Biles who made the first move." Simone is quoted saying, "I saw him and I was like, 'Oh, he's pretty cute, so I said hi.'" She describes how they started chatting due to living in the Houston area and hung out soon after.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with an aerial view of an airport, showcasing multiple airplanes parked at gates and a large terminal building. The scene transitions to a close-up of a man and a woman standing together, both dressed in white outfits, with the woman wearing a sports jersey with the number 36. They are at an event, as indicated by the presence of a large fan and other people in the background. The next scene features a woman in a red sweatshirt with the text '#no competition' and 'SK-II Studio' on a red backdrop, suggesting a promotional event. Following this, two women are seen sitting on a gymnastics beam, with one holding a microphone labeled 'ACC', indicating an interview setting. The video then shows a close-up of a man and a woman embracing, with text overlaying the image that reads, 'WE KIND OF IF INITIALLY LET OURSELVES, SSEE WE BEAC OTHER...' (We kind of if initially let ourselves, see we beac other...). The scene shifts to a man and a woman standing side by side, with the text 'WE KIND OF WER JUST LIKE MAGNETS.' (We kind of were just like magnets.) displayed at the bottom. The next frame shows a man in a black hoodie speaking, with the text 'WE JUST KNEW WE REGN OUR DREAMS AND WE NYY USARY: WANT TO SEE PERSONN...' (We just knew we reign our dreams and we nyy usary: want to see personn...) at the bottom. The video concludes with a woman in a gym setting, wearing a gray jacket and holding a water bottle, with a large screen displaying an image of a gymnast in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with light, upbeat music. A man speaks, explaining how two people spent time together during the pandemic, a perk athletes typically lack. He describes them alternating visits and their dogs playing together, and quotes, "we kind of had that time to ourselves to see if we like each other," and then "we kind of were just like magnets." Another man echoes the sentiment, saying they wanted to see each other more. The man also notes, "my dog really loved her." The music then resumes.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a tender moment between a man and a woman, where the man, shirtless and wearing a necklace, feeds the woman with a spoon, creating a sense of intimacy. The scene transitions to a close-up of a ring with a large central stone and smaller stones along the band, set against a red background, suggesting a proposal. The narrative then shifts to an outdoor setting where the man, now in a light gray suit, proposes to the woman in a black dress, capturing a joyful and celebratory atmosphere. The couple is later seen standing in front of a red helicopter, symbolizing a special occasion or getaway. The video concludes with a festive scene where the man, dressed in a white suit, toasts with a group of people, indicating a celebration or party, with the woman in a white dress holding a decorative item, adding to the festive mood. The video captures a progression of romantic and celebratory moments, highlighting the couple's relationship and special events.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing a couple's decision to spend more time together early in their relationship. He mentions their engagement in 2022, almost two years after meeting on a dating app, noting that "people weren't surprised, but they were extremely supportive of the happy couple." This narration transitions into a brief segment of what seems to be music.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman sitting against a purple background, wearing a black top with gold buttons and blue jeans. She appears to be speaking, as her mouth moves and her hands gesture. The scene transitions to a photograph of a man in a light gray suit kneeling on one knee, holding a ring box, proposing to a woman in a black dress with lace-up details. The text overlay reads, "I don't want to spend forever ever with you, you're everything I dreamed of and more!" (indicating the man's heartfelt proposal). The next scene shows the couple in a close embrace, with the woman wearing a white strapless top and the man in a gray shirt, both appearing intimate and affectionate. The video then returns to the proposal scene, with the woman bending down to look at the ring box, and concludes with a photograph of the couple standing together, the woman covering her face with her hands in a gesture of surprise or joy, while the man stands beside her, smiling. The background in the proposal scenes features a porch with white railings and a natural outdoor setting, creating a romantic atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with music, a pleasant tune which creates a warm mood. The music fades into the background as a male voice begins speaking in a neutral tone. He describes an Instagram post in which Simone said that saying yes was the "easiest yes" she'd ever had to say and looked forward to spending forever with her partner. The speaker continues, describing Jonathan's post in which he bragged about waking up with a fiance the day after Valentine's Day. He also thanked a friend for helping him plan the proposal, which his then-girlfriend had no clue about.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman in a white sleeveless top and blue jeans, sitting on a red chair in a gymnasium, holding a smartphone and watching a video of a gymnast performing a routine. The scene transitions to a close-up of two women looking at a smartphone together, followed by a man and a woman standing outside a house, smiling. The narrative then shifts to a wedding ceremony where a man in a beige suit and a woman in a white dress stand facing each other, holding hands, with an officiant in a black robe in the background. The video continues with a woman in a yellow sleeveless top speaking in a gymnasium, with text on the screen reading, "We had to get married 'legally' here in the US since our wedding wall is a destination we 'ding, ding, ding'." The couple is then shown exiting a building, holding hands, with the man in a beige suit and the woman in a white wedding dress holding a bouquet of white flowers. The scene transitions to a gymnast in a red leotard performing a routine in a gymnasium, followed by a close-up of a woman in a white sleeveless top and blue jeans sitting on a red chair, holding a smartphone. The video concludes with a man and a woman posing together in a studio, both wearing white tops and jeans, with the man embracing the woman from behind.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male narrator describing Simone Biles obtaining a marriage license in April of 2023, quoting her Instagram post as saying, "almost time to say I do". He then states that "the couple had their courthouse wedding" and quotes the gymnast's Instagram story again, "we had to get married legally here in the US, since our wedding will be a destination wedding." The narrator mentions that she changed her Instagram and Twitter accounts to include her new last name. He continues by saying that she revealed that she and her husband weren't done celebrating their marriage because they had a destination wedding planned for May.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a couple walking hand in hand by a poolside, dressed in casual beachwear, with the man in a white hat and orange shorts and the woman in a white cover-up and bikini. The scene transitions to a wedding ceremony where the same couple stands facing each other, the man in a white suit and the woman in a white lace wedding dress, exchanging vows under a floral arch. The couple shares a kiss, and the groom lifts the bride in a joyful embrace. The ceremony takes place on a beach with a large audience seated in front of the couple, who are standing under a floral arch. The video then shows a close-up of the couple walking together, framed by branches, followed by a view of a beautifully set table with elegant glassware and a monogrammed napkin. The final scene features an aerial view of ocean waves crashing onto the shore, with text overlaying the image that reads, "IT SPRINKLED FOR TWO MINUTES AFTER WE GOT MARRIED—WHI H IS GOOD LUCK!—AND WE HAD A FULL MOON." The video captures the progression from a casual beach outing to a formal wedding ceremony, highlighting the couple's love and the celebratory atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: A male voice announces a wedding that took place in Cabo, Mexico in front of "144 guests," emphasizing the couple's light-hearted approach. The speaker quotes Simone sharing, "Jonathan and I just tuned into each other and blocked everyone out," and mentions her falling in love with him "all over." After being declared husband and wife, they walked to the "beat of water drums," and, according to Simone, whales were jumping out of the water. She adds that a sprinkle of rain and a full moon made the day "truly the most magical."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a woman with long, dark hair, smiling joyfully against a blurred outdoor background. The scene transitions to her in a white wedding dress, standing in a modern, well-lit room with wooden furniture and a bed, exuding happiness. A close-up of her ear and hair follows, with a blurred outdoor setting in the background. The narrative then shifts to a magazine cover featuring the woman in a pink dress, with the text 'VANITY FAIR' and 'Simone Biles' prominently displayed, indicating her feature in the magazine. The video continues with a couple in formal attire, embracing under a fireworks display, suggesting a celebratory event. The scene then moves to a gymnastics competition, where the woman, now in a blue leotard, performs a routine on the floor, showcasing her athleticism and skill. The video concludes with a tweet from 'simonebiles' expressing gratitude for capturing a special day, accompanied by a heart emoji, indicating a personal and emotional moment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with background music, sounding like a modern pop song with a mellow and slightly dreamy mood. The music fades to a quieter level as a male speaker begins to describe how "special the event was for her," saying she had it "pinned on her Instagram feed" with a caption about Mr. and Mrs. Owen. He proceeds to mention a Vanity Fair cover where she said "her wedding was better than her first Olympic win," noting she said, "I've never had so much fun in my life." He further quotes her as saying, "My wedding topped it" and "It was the greatest feeling ever." The man sounds conversational and informative. The audio concludes by mentioning she was taking time off from the sport at the time. The music remains quiet throughout.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a gymnast in a white jacket and red shirt, wiping her face with her hand, suggesting a moment of emotional intensity. The scene transitions to a photograph of a woman in a light-colored sleeveless top, striking a graceful pose with her hair flowing, set against a neutral background. The narrative then shifts to a woman with long braided hair, wearing a light-colored sweater, seated in a studio with a blue wall and a window showing an outdoor scene with trees and buildings. The focus returns to the gymnast, now in a black leotard with sparkling details, performing a routine on a blue mat with an American flag in the background, showcasing her athleticism and skill. The gymnast is then seen in a close-up, emphasizing her focused expression and the intricate details of her leotard. The scene transitions to a press conference where the gymnast, now in a white jacket with a blue ribbon and a nameplate reading 'Simone Biles,' speaks into a microphone, indicating her role as a prominent athlete. The video then moves to a news studio with two individuals seated at a desk, one with long braided hair in a light-colored sweater and the other in a blue shirt, discussing in front of a backdrop featuring the Brooklyn Bridge and New York City skyline, with the text 'MORNING NEWS NOW' displayed on a screen, suggesting a morning news segment. The video concludes with a close-up of the woman in the light-colored sweater, maintaining the studio setting and the news broadcast atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with male narration discussing Simone Biles' decision to step away from professional competition, citing mental health concerns. The narrator references "the twisties," a mental block, and her advocacy for mental health prioritization. A female speaker follows, sharing the sentiment, "For them, it's not an injury, but it almost is, and it has a worse effect on you." The male narration then returns, mentioning a two-year hiatus.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman in a white sleeveless top speaking in a room with a red bowl and green plant in the background. The scene transitions to a gymnast in a pink leotard performing on a balance beam, showcasing her skills with a focused expression. A text overlay appears, stating 'Simone Biles finishes with four golds at 2023 Gymnastics World Championships,' highlighting her achievement. The video then shows a close-up of the gymnast in a blue leotard with red and yellow stars, standing in a competition setting. Following this, the gymnast is seen holding multiple medals in front of an American flag, symbolizing her success. The video continues with the gymnast performing a high-flying routine in a pink leotard, demonstrating her athleticism. The final scene features the gymnast in a dark blue jacket with a yellow scarf, holding several gold medals in front of a backdrop with various sponsor logos, including 'VTB,' 'SPIETH,' 'DAIMLER,' 'FUJITSU,' and 'LONGINES,' indicating her victory at the 2019 World Championships in Stuttgart. The video captures the gymnast's journey from preparation to triumph, emphasizing her skill, dedication, and achievements in gymnastics.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker excitedly summarizing a gymnast's impressive year, mentioning her comeback after her wedding, participation in competitions, and winning multiple medals, including gold at the Gymnastics World Championships, not to mention a move named after her. Throughout this speech, upbeat background music plays, lending an energetic tone to the narration.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a couple walking hand in hand down a set of stairs in a park, surrounded by trees and a gazebo, creating a serene atmosphere. The scene transitions to a close-up of a man with braided hair, wearing a black hoodie and a silver chain, speaking directly to the camera, suggesting an interview or personal message. Following this, a woman in a cream-colored dress is seen sitting on a red chair, gesturing as she speaks, with a vintage projector beside her, indicating a formal interview setting. The narrative then shifts to a lively scene of a crowd holding signs that read "I love Biles & Chiles" and "USA," celebrating a sports event, likely related to gymnastics. The video continues with a woman in a white sweatshirt with "Team USA" written on it, walking through a crowd with cameras and flags, emphasizing the public and media attention. A series of posters featuring gymnasts in action, with the text "Athletist" and "Methodist," highlights the athletic theme. The scene then moves outdoors, showing a sign that reads "STOP THE SPREAD! KEEP 2 METERS BETWEEN YOU AND ANYONE YOU SEE," promoting social distancing. The video concludes with a couple in matching plaid pajamas, standing in front of a decorated Christmas tree, smiling warmly, suggesting a cozy, festive moment. The sequence of frames captures a blend of personal, professional, and celebratory moments, transitioning smoothly from one scene to the next.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the negative feedback a man received for not knowing about his wife until months into their relationship. The speaker mentions that the wife is a gymnast. The tone is informative, almost like a news report. He says the man didn't realize the "magnitude of his wife's influence," and how she "never been bothered by the anecdote." The speaker goes on to state that the couple spent a lot of time together during the pandemic and that their love was "based on respect and genuine attraction over her stardom." Once the husband caught on, "he made up for it." There is music playing faintly in the background during this entire clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a gymnast performing a routine on a blue mat in a large indoor arena filled with spectators. The gymnast, dressed in a black and white leotard, executes a series of flips and jumps, showcasing her athleticism and precision. The audience watches attentively, with some capturing the performance on their devices. The scene transitions to a man in a black hoodie being interviewed in a locker room, surrounded by microphones from various media outlets, including FOX 32 and FOX 11. The man speaks into the microphones, likely sharing his thoughts or experiences related to the event. The video then returns to the gymnastics arena, where another gymnast in a purple leotard performs a routine on a blue mat, executing flips and jumps with grace and skill. The audience remains engaged, and the atmosphere is lively and supportive. The scene shifts to a photograph of a man and a young girl, with the girl holding a pink rose. The text overlay reads, 'First time getting to watch you compete in person and you didn't disappoint. I'm so proud of you, my lil champ.' This personal moment highlights the pride and support from family. The video continues with the man in the black hoodie, now wearing a shirt with the 'Insurance Industry Charitable Foundation' logo, interacting with others in a crowded area, possibly a backstage or waiting area. The final scene features a football player in a green jersey with the number 34, running on a field during a practice session. The player, wearing yellow shorts and gloves, appears focused and determined, with other players visible in the background. The video captures a blend of athletic performances, personal moments, and professional interactions, showcasing the dedication and support within the sports community.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an upbeat and energetic pop song playing in the background. A male speaker starts talking in a conversational tone, mentioning that "Biles competed again in June 2021," he was there to watch his then-girlfriend compete. In a post he said "What an amazing experience," and expressing pride for her accomplishments. He concludes by saying the love and support remains as strong as ever and that "the NFL star recently signed with the Chicago Bears." The pop music continues playing underneath his speech.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman in a black strapless dress sitting on a couch, engaged in a conversation, with a cityscape backdrop. It transitions to a tweet from Simone Biles, showing her and a man in a football uniform at a stadium, expressing excitement about not having a connecting flight to see her husband. The scene shifts to a couple on a couch, followed by a black-and-white photo of them walking on a beach, holding hands. The next frame shows a close-up of their hands, highlighting a ring on the woman's finger. The video then features a couple posing together, with the woman in a white off-shoulder dress and the man in a purple shirt, against a backdrop of falling snow. The scene changes to a couple in a room with white blinds, the woman in a pink shirt and the man in a white shirt, both smiling. The video concludes with a woman in a cream-colored dress sitting on a red chair, with a projector beside her, in a dark room. Throughout the video, the atmosphere is intimate and personal, focusing on the couple's relationship and shared moments.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing Simone Biles's live tweeting and move to Chicago, specifically mentioning the food and O'Hare International Airport. The speaker quotes her tweet, saying "So incredibly proud of my husband. The grind never stops." The speaker then notes that she celebrated her 27th birthday. The male speaker mentions Instagram stories featuring her birthday weekend with her husband. Continuing, the speaker says that her husband penned a sweet birthday message and quoted "Happy birthday to the most beautiful soul, my amazing wife." The speaker concludes with a question, "Will we actually see him supporting Simone Biles in Paris?"
